title: UDL-Based Simulation Training for Construction Workforce Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic mathematical concepts (area, volume calculations, etc.) and familiarity with basic construction site terminology
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education utilizing VR simulations in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: The mathematical analysis of material properties (strength, durability, etc.) required at construction sites can be used to explain optimal material selection criteria.
VR-based simulations can recreate the installation process of construction materials, and applying geometric calculations (area/volume estimation, etc.) can reduce work errors by over 30%.
Through team project execution, learners can design and evaluate solutions to onsite problems, demonstrating thinking skills at or above Bloomâ€™s Taxonomy Level 4 (analysis-evaluation-creation).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
